intro: Cerinthe connivens, commonly known as the narrow-leaved toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces blue or violet flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Cerinthe connivens is typically herbaceous, with slender leaves and a compact growth habit.
